title: Upgrade Path Map
description: Visualize every logical upgrade route through the Arco product lineup. Each path shows the budget delta, what you gain, and why the move makes sense. Plan your coffee journey from entry-level to endgame.
hero_image_alt: An infographic-style path diagram showing Arco machines and grinders connected by arrows, starting from entry-level at the bottom to flagship at the top

edges.rationale: The biggest single upgrade you can make. Moving from steam pressure to pump-driven espresso transforms shot quality. The Nano adds PID temperature control and a proper portafilter.
Skip the learning curve entirely. The Automatico handles grinding, dosing, tamping, and brewing — just add beans and press a button.
The step up from compact to full-size. The Classica's larger boiler means better temperature stability across back-to-back shots and real steam power for milk drinks.
A bigger jump that skips the mid-tier. The Barista Pro adds pre-infusion control, a pressure gauge, and a professional steam arm. Ideal if you are serious about latte art.
Trading convenience for control. You will need a separate grinder, but gain hands-on command of every variable. The jump to manual espresso-making unlocks much higher quality ceilings.
The natural next step. Pre-infusion, a pressure gauge, and the cool-touch steam wand make the Barista Pro the most capable single-boiler in the range.
A lateral move for those who want tactile connection to the extraction. Lever machines reward skilled operators with espresso that no pump machine can replicate.
From single-boiler to heat-exchange. The Maestro lets you brew and steam simultaneously — no more waiting between pulling a shot and frothing milk.
The endgame for precision-focused baristas. Independent PID control of brew and steam temperature. No compromises.
Moving from heat-exchange to true dual-boiler gives you independent temperature control. Critical for light-roast espresso where brew temperature precision matters most.
Larger 50mm burrs grind faster and more uniformly. The single biggest grinder upgrade for the money. You will taste the difference immediately in espresso clarity.

A flavour-profile shift rather than a pure upgrade. Conical burrs produce a different particle distribution that emphasizes body and sweetness over clarity. Great for medium-dark roasts and traditional espresso.
The definitive grinder upgrade. 64mm flat burrs deliver surgical precision in particle size distribution. You will notice increased clarity, sweetness, and complexity in every cup.
Moving from conical to large flat burrs prioritizes clarity and origin-character expression. If you drink light roasts or single origins, this is the right move.
